title.narrative: 1.3 WASH:2-1. CHILD SURVIVAL AND DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Communities, schools and health centers have increased and equitable access to safe water and improved sanitation and hygiene services, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children, adolescents and women use improved and equitable high-impact Health, HIV, Nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, schools and health centers have increased and equitable access to safe water and improved sanitation and hygieneservices

description.narrative: Access to WASH has increased. UNICEF continues to work closely with the Government to provide technical and financial support to strengthen the enabling environment and provide communities, schools, and health centres with safe water and improved sanitation and hygiene services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/10/2018
